definition: erhua variant of 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
to visit relatives
erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]
to visit frequently/to have frequent dealings (with)/to see each other often
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
(dialect) to chat/to gossip
(dialect) to chat/to gossip
to talk or chat about ordinary daily life
to chat/idle gossip
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
chat/gossip/spin a yarn
to freeload for food
erhua variant of 遛彎|遛弯[liu4 wan1]
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
(coll.) wife's elder sister/sister-in-law
